overview_of_class: This course will introduce you to the cultural history of eastern Africa, a region that includes today's Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, Rwanda, Burundi, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, southern Sudan, southern Ethiopia, and southern Somalia.  The course follows chronological developments in two major regions of East Africa: the Great Lakes region and the Indian Ocean coast.  No previous knowledge of African history is required. The course will (1) introduce you to non-traditional sources for history?archaeology, environment, historical linguistics, comparative ethnography, and oral traditions?in addition to more conventional textual sources; (2) explore the rise and significance of agriculture in the region; (3) depict the shifting historical relationships between health, wealth, political culture, and social identity; (4) examine the growth of monarchies in many areas of eastern Africa; (5) explore the history of slavery; and (6) engage the cosmopolitan aspirations that tied Eastern Africa to wider worlds.
name: East Africa
subject: HISTORY
